result.execSummary:
The defendant Joanna Delgadillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the jail sentence may be served with huber.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

miscConds.notes:
-AODA and any follow-up.
-No Violent contact with the victim.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
11:45 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with probation.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.  Huber if revoked.  Out of county travel and out of county service.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-AODA and any follow-up.
-No Violent contact with the victim.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 11:52 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 11:30 am.

9:52 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - have an offer that include probation and need time for defendant to appear as she resides out of state.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on May 31, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:53 a.m.
